services.title: Psychological First Aid
services.short: Immediate emotional support during crisis or distress.

details.description: Psychological First Aid (PFA) provides immediate, compassionate support to individuals facing acute stress, trauma, or crisis.
details.who: Anyone experiencing shock, emotional distress, trauma, crisis events, or overwhelming stress.
methodology: Ensuring safety, comfort, and a calm environment.
Listening without pressuring the person to talk.
Assessing immediate needs and providing practical assistance.
Connecting individuals to social support and professional help.
Offering grounding techniques to manage acute stress.
details.duration: Usually delivered immediately after a crisis, lasting 20–45 minutes.
details.notes: PFA is not formal therapy. It is early emotional support.

details.description: Individual therapy focuses on personal growth, coping strategies, and overcoming anxiety, depression, or stress.
details.who: Adults, adolescents, and teens facing emotional or psychological difficulties.
methodology: Goal setting and coping strategy development.
Tracking progress and giving small tasks.

details.description: Couples counseling helps partners improve communication and rebuild trust.
details.who: Couples experiencing relationship conflict or communication issues.
details.notes: Both partners must attend sessions regularly.

details.description: Group therapy provides a safe environment to share experiences and learn coping skills from peers.
details.who: Individuals needing peer support or social development.

details.description: Online consultation offers therapy through video calls with flexible scheduling.
details.who: Individuals or couples who prefer remote therapy.
details.notes: Requires stable internet and private space.

services.title: Play Therapy
services.short: Helping children express emotions through play.

details.description: Play therapy helps children express feelings and develop emotional and social skills.
details.who: Children aged 3-12 with emotional or behavioral challenges.

services.title: Behavioral Therapy
services.short: Improving behavior and coping skills in children.

details.description: Behavioral therapy helps children reduce negative behaviors and develop positive habits.
details.who: Children with ADHD, anxiety, or behavioral issues.

details.description: Child counseling helps with emotional, school, and social issues.
details.who: Children facing emotional or academic challenges.
